Diets: Bland diet, small meals, hydration (water, ginger tea).

Description: Excessive sweating not related to heat or exercise.
Symptoms: Excessive sweating (palms, soles, armpits).
Precautions: Avoid triggers (heat, stress), wear breathable fabrics.
Medications: Antiperspirants, botox injections, anticholinergics.
Diets: Hydration, avoid spicy foods, caffeine.

Description: High potassium levels in the blood.
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, abnormal heart rhythm.
Precautions: Monitor potassium intake, regular checkups.
Medications: Diuretics, potassium-binding agents.
Diets: Low-potassium diet (avoid bananas, potatoes).

Description: Low potassium levels in the blood.
Symptoms: Weakness, fatigue, muscle cramps.
Precautions: Potassium supplementation, avoid excessive diuretics.
Medications: Potassium supplements, potassium-sparing diuretics.
Diets: High-potassium foods (bananas, spinach, sweet potatoes).

Description: Low magnesium levels in the blood.
Symptoms: Muscle cramps, weakness, irritability.
Precautions: Adequate magnesium intake, avoid excess alcohol.
Medications: Magnesium supplements, IV magnesium in severe cases.
Diets: Magnesium-rich foods (nuts, seeds, leafy greens).

Description: Low phosphate levels in the blood.
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, confusion, respiratory issues.
Precautions: Adequate phosphate intake, avoid antacids.
Medications: Phosphate supplements, IV phosphate in severe cases.
Diets: Phosphate-rich foods (dairy, nuts, whole grains).

Description: A congenital heart defect where the left side of the heart is underdeveloped.
Symptoms: Rapid breathing, poor feeding, cyanosis.
Precautions: Early diagnosis, frequent monitoring, surgery planning
Medications: Surgery (Norwood procedure), heart transplant.
Diets: High-calorie diet for infants, supplemental feeding.

Description: Increased pressure around the brain with no known cause.
Symptoms: Headache, vision problems, nausea.
Precautions: Regular eye exams, weight management.
Medications: Diuretics (acetazolamide), lumbar puncture.
Diets: Low-sodium diet, maintain healthy weight.

Description: Chronic lung disease causing lung tissue scarring.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, dry cough, fatigue.
Precautions: Avoid smoking, exposure to lung irritants.
Medications: Antifibrotic drugs (pirfenidone), oxygen therapy.
Diets: Balanced diet, high-protein foods, avoid processed foods.

Description: Immune disorder causing low platelet levels.
Symptoms: Easy bruising, bleeding gums, nosebleeds.
Precautions: Avoid blood-thinning medications, monitor bruising.
Medications: Corticosteroids, immunoglobulins, splenectomy in severe cases.
Diets: Iron-rich foods, balanced diet to support overall health.

Description: Infection of the heart valves or inner lining of the heart.
Symptoms: Fever, chills, heart murmur, fatigue.
Precautions: Maintain oral hygiene, avoid IV drug use.
Medications: Antibiotics, surgery for damaged heart valves.
Diets: Balanced diet, limit alcohol, adequate hydration.

Description: A tumor in the pancreas that produces excess insulin.
Symptoms: Hypoglycemia, sweating, dizziness, confusion.
Precautions: Frequent blood glucose monitoring, avoid fasting.
Medications: Surgical removal, medications like diazoxide.
Diets: Frequent, small meals, include protein and healthy fats.

Description: Inflammation and injury of the colon due to reduced blood flow.
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, diarrhea, rectal bleeding.
Precautions: Avoid smoking, stay hydrated, manage heart health.
Medications: IV fluids, antibiotics, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: High-fiber diet, hydration, avoid fatty foods.

Description: Genetic disorder affecting skull and feet.
Symptoms: Skull malformations, broad toes.
Precautions: Regular monitoring of development.
Medications: Surgery for skeletal deformities.
Diets: Balanced diet to support overall health.

Description: Chronic arthritis in children.
Symptoms: Joint swelling, pain, stiffness.
Precautions: Exercise, avoid joint strain.
Medications: NSAIDs, corticosteroids, DMARDs.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet (fish, fruits, veggies).

Description: Thinning and bulging of the cornea.
Symptoms: Blurred vision, sensitivity to light.
Precautions: Avoid eye rubbing, protect eyes.
Medications: Glasses, contact lenses, corneal cross-linking.
Diets: Nutrient-rich diet, particularly antioxidants (green leafy vegetables).

Description: Brain damage due to high bilirubin in newborns.
Symptoms: Yellow skin, poor feeding, lethargy.
Precautions: Early treatment of jaundice.
Medications: Phototherapy, exchange transfusion.
Diets: Breastfeeding, frequent feedings.

Description: Loss of blood supply to the lunate bone in the wrist.
Symptoms: Wrist pain, stiffness, swelling.
Precautions: Avoid repetitive wrist movements.
Medications: NSAIDs, surgery.
Diets: Balanced diet to support bone health (calcium, vitamin D).

Description: Rare brain disorder due to damage to the temporal lobes.
Symptoms: Compulsive eating, hypersexuality, memory loss.
Precautions: Safe environment, monitor behavior.
Medications: Antipsychotics, anticonvulsants.
Diets: Well-balanced diet, avoid triggers for compulsive eating.

Description: Rare genetic disorder affecting nervous system.
Symptoms: Irritability, developmental delay, muscle weakness.
Precautions: Genetic counseling, early diagnosis.
Medications: Stem cell transplants, supportive care.
Diets: Nutrient-dense, soft foods for ease of swallowing.

Description: Autoimmune disorder affecting nerve-muscle communication.
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, dry mouth, drooping eyelids.
Precautions: Avoid triggers, regular physical therapy.
Medications: Immunosuppressants, plasmapheresis.
Diets: Balanced diet to maintain muscle strength.

Description: Rare disorder causing excessive production of Langerhans cells.
Symptoms: Skin rashes, bone pain, swollen lymph nodes.
Precautions: Regular monitoring, avoid injury.
Medications: Chemotherapy, steroids.
Diets: Healthy, nutrient-dense diet to support immune function.

Description: Congenital softening of the larynx in infants.
Symptoms: Noisy breathing, difficulty feeding.
Precautions: Upright feeding, small frequent meals.
Medications: Observation, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Adequate nutrition for growth, breastfeeding or formula.

Description: Severe childhood epilepsy.
Symptoms: Seizures, developmental delay.
Precautions: Seizure precautions, avoid triggers.
Medications: Anti-seizure medications, ketogenic diet.
Diets: Ketogenic diet (high fat, low carb).

Description: Inflammatory skin condition.
Symptoms: Itchy, flat-topped bumps on skin, mouth sores.
Precautions: Avoid triggers, maintain skin hygiene.
Medications: Topical corticosteroids, antihistamines.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, avoid spicy/acidic foods.

Description: A rare genetic disorder causing increased blood pressure due to excessive sodium retention.
Symptoms: High blood pressure, low potassium levels, muscle weakness.
Precautions: Monitor blood pressure, potassium levels; avoid excess salt intake.
Medications: Potassium-sparing diuretics, antihypertensives.
Diets: Low-sodium diet, increase potassium-rich foods (e.g., bananas, spinach).

Description: A rare inherited disorder characterized by deposits of lipids and proteins in the skin and mucous membranes.
Symptoms: Hoarse voice, skin scarring, difficulty breathing.
Precautions: Protect skin from trauma, avoid harsh skincare products.
Medications: No specific medications, supportive care for symptoms (e.g., corticosteroids).
Diets: No specific diet. Focus on overall nutrition and hydration.

Description: A rare brain malformation due to abnormal neuronal migration, leading to a smooth brain surface.
Symptoms: Developmental delays, seizures, muscle spasms.
Precautions: Early intervention therapies, supportive care.
Medications: Antiepileptic drugs for seizure management.
Diets: Balanced diet with nutrient-rich foods to support overall health.

Description: A heart rhythm disorder that can cause fast, chaotic heartbeats, sometimes leading to fainting or sudden death.
Symptoms: Fainting, arrhythmias, palpitations.
Precautions: Avoid stress, strenuous exercise, and medications that prolong QT interval.
Medications: Beta-blockers, anti-arrhythmic drugs, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) in severe cases.
Diets: Heart-healthy diet, avoid stimulant foods like caffeine.

Description: An inflammation of the kidneys caused by systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
Symptoms: Swelling in legs/feet, high blood pressure, foamy urine.
Precautions: Regular kidney function tests, manage lupus triggers.
Medications: Immunosuppressants, corticosteroids, ACE inhibitors.
Diets: Low-sodium, low-protein, and low-potassium diet.

Description: A rare lung disease affecting women, where abnormal muscle cells grow in the lungs and lymph nodes.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, chest pain, frequent lung infections.
Precautions: Regular lung function tests, avoid smoking.
Medications: mTOR inhibitors (e.g., sirolimus), bronchodilators.
Diets: Balanced diet with focus on anti-inflammatory foods (fruits, vegetables, whole grains).

Description: A type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) causing chronic diarrhea.
Symptoms: Watery diarrhea, abdominal cramps, fatigue.
Precautions: Avoid NSAIDs, reduce triggers like caffeine, lactose, and fatty foods.
Medications: Anti-inflammatory drugs, antidiarrheal medications.
Diets: Low-fat, lactose-free, and low-fiber diet to reduce diarrhea symptoms.

Description: A severe reaction to certain drugs used during anesthesia, causing a rapid rise in body temperature and severe muscle contractions.
Symptoms: High fever, muscle stiffness, dark urine, rapid heart rate.
Precautions: Inform anesthesiologist of condition before surgery; carry medical ID bracelet.
Medications: Dantrolene, supportive care during surgery.
Diets: No specific diet. Maintain balanced nutrition.

Description: A genetic disorder where the body is unable to break down certain amino acids, leading to toxic buildup.
Symptoms: Sweet-smelling urine, poor feeding, vomiting, lethargy.
Precautions: Early diagnosis and dietary management, avoid foods high in branched-chain amino acids (BCAAs).
Medications: Specialized formula low in BCAAs, thiamine supplements.
Diets: Strict avoidance of foods high in BCAAs (e.g., meat, dairy).

Description: A rare muscle disorder where the body is unable to break down glycogen for energy during exercise.
Symptoms: Muscle cramps, fatigue, dark urine after exercise.
Precautions: Avoid strenuous exercise, gradual warm-ups before activity.
Medications: No specific medications; exercise modification and supportive therapy.
Diets: High-protein, low-carb diet; ensure adequate hydration.

Description: A serious infection of the mediastinum (the central part of the chest) often occurring after heart surgery.
Symptoms: Chest pain, fever, shortness of breath.
Precautions: Regular wound care post-surgery, early detection.
Medications: Broad-spectrum antibiotics, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: No specific diet. Focus on nutrition to support recovery.

Description: A neurological movement disorder causing involuntary muscle contractions, particularly in the face.
Symptoms: Eye twitching, facial grimacing, difficulty speaking.
Precautions: Avoid triggers like stress, fatigue; get adequate sleep.
Medications: Botulinum toxin injections, oral medications (e.g., anticholinergics).
Diets: Balanced diet, ensure hydration and avoid caffeine or alcohol if they trigger symptoms.

Description: A rare neurological disorder characterized by involuntary muscle contractions affecting the face and neck.
Symptoms: Involuntary muscle contractions, excessive blinking, facial grimacing, jaw clenching, neck movements.
Precautions: Stress management, avoid triggers like bright lights, regular eye exams.

Description: A rare neurological disorder that involves recurring facial paralysis, swelling, and a fissured tongue.

Precautions: Regular dental and oral care, stress management, avoid facial injuries.
Medications: Corticosteroids, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), immunosuppressants.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, avoid processed foods, increase intake of omega-3 fatty acids (e.g., fish, flaxseeds).

Description: A rare condition involving overgrowth of the stomach lining, leading to protein loss and digestive issues.
Symptoms: Severe stomach pain, nausea, vomiting, weight loss, swelling of the abdomen, protein loss.

Diets: High-protein diet, small frequent meals, avoid spicy and acidic foods, include easily digestible foods.

Description: A genetic disorder affecting copper levels in the body, leading to developmental issues and neurological degeneration.
Symptoms: Kinky hair, failure to thrive, developmental delay, hypotonia, seizures, progressive neurodegeneration.
Precautions: Genetic counseling, early diagnosis, regular monitoring of growth and development.
Medications: Copper injections, supportive care, anticonvulsants for seizures.
Diets: Nutrient-rich diet, ensure adequate intake of vitamins and minerals, avoid copper-deficient foods.

Description: A genetic disorder causing the progressive destruction of white matter in the brain, leading to neurological decline.
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, difficulty walking, seizures, vision and hearing loss, developmental regression.
Precautions: Genetic counseling, early intervention, physical therapy, occupational therapy.
Medications: Bone marrow transplant, enzyme replacement therapy, symptomatic treatment for seizures and spasticity.
Diets: Balanced diet, high in antioxidants, ensure proper hydration, consider omega-3 supplements for neurological support.

Description: A chronic inflammatory condition of the colon that causes persistent diarrhea.
Symptoms: Chronic, non-bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain, cramping, weight loss, fatigue.
Precautions: Avoid NSAIDs, manage stress, avoid trigger foods, maintain hydration.
Medications: Anti-inflammatory medications (budesonide), antidiarrheals, immune modulators.
Diets: Low-fat diet, avoid caffeine and alcohol, lactose-free diet, small frequent meals, avoid gluten if sensitive.

Description: A group of neuromuscular diseases caused by damage to the mitochondria, leading to muscle weakness and other systemic symptoms.
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, exercise intolerance, fatigue, heart problems, hearing loss, breathing difficulties.
Precautions: Avoid heavy exercise, manage stress, regular check-ups for heart and respiratory functions.
Medications: Supportive therapies (e.g., physical therapy), Coenzyme Q10 supplements, antioxidants.
Diets: High-protein diet, frequent small meals, avoid fasting, ensure adequate vitamin intake (especially B vitamins and CoQ10).

Description: A collection of pus that has built up within the tissue of the body due to an infection.
Symptoms: Painful, swollen area of skin, redness, warmth, pus drainage, fever.
Precautions: Good hygiene, avoid squeezing or popping the abscess, keep the area clean, seek medical attention for large or persistent abscesses.
Medications: Antibiotics, drainage procedure, pain relief medications.
Diets: Balanced diet, adequate hydration, increase intake of foods that support the immune system (e.g., fruits, vegetables, lean proteins).

Description: Inflammation of the Achilles tendon, often due to overuse or injury.
Symptoms: Heel pain, stiffness, swelling, tenderness, pain that worsens with activity.
Precautions: Proper footwear, stretching before exercise, avoid sudden increases in activity level.
Medications: NSAIDs, corticosteroid injections, physical therapy, rest.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, increase intake of omega-3 fatty acids, avoid processed and sugary foods, hydrate well.

Description: A non-cancerous tumor on the main nerve leading from the inner ear to the brain, affecting hearing and balance.
Symptoms: Hearing loss, tinnitus (ringing in the ears), balance issues, dizziness, facial numbness.
Precautions: Regular hearing tests, avoid loud noises, early intervention for hearing and balance issues.
Medications: Surgical removal, radiation therapy, observation in slow-growing cases.
Diets: Balanced diet, adequate hydration, limit caffeine and salt to reduce symptoms of tinnitus and dizziness.

Description: Rough, scaly patches on the skin caused by sun exposure, which can potentially develop into skin cancer.
Symptoms: Rough, scaly skin patches, itching, burning, sensitive skin, lesion that doesn’t heal.
Precautions: Sun protection, regular skin exams, avoid tanning beds.
Medications: Cryotherapy, topical medications (e.g., 5-fluorouracil), laser therapy.
Diets: Antioxidant-rich diet, increase intake of vitamin C and E, avoid excessive sun exposure, stay hydrated.

Description: A condition where the inner lining of the uterus breaks through the muscle wall, causing heavy periods and pelvic pain.
Symptoms: Heavy menstrual bleeding, severe cramping, bloating, pelvic pain, pain during intercourse.
Precautions: Regular gynecological check-ups, manage menstrual pain with heat therapy, maintain a healthy weight.
Medications: NSAIDs, hormonal therapies (e.g., birth control), surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, avoid processed foods, increase intake of fruits, vegetables, and omega-3 fatty acids, consider a low-estrogen diet.

Description: A condition where the adrenal glands do not produce enough hormones, leading to various systemic symptoms.
Symptoms: Fatigue, weight loss, low blood pressure, darkening of the skin, salt cravings, muscle weakness.
Precautions: Regular medication adherence, manage stress, avoid sudden discontinuation of steroids.
Medications: Corticosteroids (e.g., hydrocortisone), mineralocorticoids (e.g., fludrocortisone), salt supplements.
Diets: High-sodium diet during hot weather, balanced diet with adequate protein, ensure regular meal times, avoid fasting.

Description: An allergic response to airborne substances such as pollen, causing nasal and sinus symptoms.
Symptoms: Sneezing, runny nose, itchy eyes, congestion, cough, fatigue.
Precautions: Avoid allergens, use air purifiers, keep windows closed during high pollen seasons.
Medications: Antihistamines, nasal corticosteroids, decongestants, immunotherapy.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, increase intake of fruits and vegetables, avoid dairy if it exacerbates symptoms, stay hydrated.

Description: A small tear in the lining of the anus, often caused by passing hard or large stools.
Symptoms: Sharp pain during bowel movements, blood in the stool, itching or irritation around the anus.
Precautions: Prevent constipation, maintain good anal hygiene, avoid straining during bowel movements.
Medications: Stool softeners, topical anesthetics, sitz baths, fiber supplements.
Diets: High-fiber diet, adequate hydration, avoid spicy and acidic foods, increase intake of fruits and vegetables.

Description: A type of arthritis that primarily affects the spine, leading to inflammation, pain, and possible fusion of the vertebrae.
Symptoms: Chronic back pain, stiffness, reduced flexibility, fatigue, pain in hips and shoulders.
Precautions: Regular exercise, good posture, physical therapy, avoid smoking.
Medications: NSAIDs, TNF blockers, physical therapy, corticosteroids.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, avoid processed foods, increase intake of omega-3 fatty acids, ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D intake.

Description: An abnormal bulge in the wall of the aorta, which can lead to life-threatening rupture if not treated.
Symptoms: Chest pain, back pain, shortness of breath, difficulty swallowing, hoarseness, pulsating sensation in the abdomen.
Precautions: Regular blood pressure monitoring, avoid heavy lifting, quit smoking, manage cholesterol levels.
Medications: Beta-blockers, statins, surgery for larger aneurysms, blood pressure medications.
Diets: Low-cholesterol diet, high in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, avoid high-sodium foods, maintain a healthy weight.

Description: A serious condition where the inner layer of the aorta tears, causing blood to flow between the layers of the aorta wall.
Symptoms: Severe chest pain, back pain, shortness of breath, fainting, difficulty speaking, stroke-like symptoms, weak pulse.
Precautions: Control blood pressure, avoid strenuous activities, regular monitoring of heart health.
Medications: Beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, surgery (for severe cases).
Diets: Low-sodium diet, avoid fatty and processed foods, high-fiber diet to maintain heart health, include omega-3 fatty acids (e.g., fish, flaxseeds).

Description: An irregular heartbeat that may be too fast, too slow, or erratic, disrupting the heart’s ability to pump blood effectively.
Symptoms: Palpitations, dizziness, fainting, shortness of breath, chest pain, fatigue.
Precautions: Regular heart monitoring, avoid stimulants (e.g., caffeine), manage stress.
Medications: Beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, antiarrhythmics, blood thinners, pacemaker.
Diets: Heart-healthy diet, low in sodium and cholesterol, rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, limit alcohol intake.

Description: A general term for joint diseases, including conditions like osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis, leading to pain and stiffness in the joints.
Symptoms: Joint pain, swelling, stiffness, reduced range of motion, fatigue, weakness.
Precautions: Maintain healthy weight, regular exercise, avoid joint strain, manage stress.
Medications: NSAIDs, corticosteroids, disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs), biologics.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, rich in omega-3 fatty acids, avoid processed and sugary foods, include calcium and vitamin D for bone health.

Description: A chronic lung disease caused by inhaling asbestos fibers, leading to lung scarring and respiratory issues.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, dry cough, chest tightness, finger clubbing, fatigue, weight loss.
Precautions: Avoid further asbestos exposure, use respiratory protection, quit smoking.
Medications: Oxygen therapy, bronchodilators, pulmonary rehabilitation, corticosteroids (in severe cases).
Diets: Balanced diet, high in antioxidants, include lean proteins, fruits, vegetables, avoid smoking and alcohol, stay hydrated.

Description: A lung infection caused by inhaling food, liquid, or vomit into the lungs instead of the stomach, leading to inflammation.
Symptoms: Cough, chest pain, shortness of breath, fever, fatigue, difficulty swallowing.
Precautions: Practice proper swallowing techniques, avoid lying down after eating, maintain good oral hygiene.
Medications: Antibiotics, oxygen therapy, fluids, pain relievers, breathing treatments (if needed).
Diets: Soft foods to prevent choking, avoid alcohol, small frequent meals, include immune-boosting foods (e.g., fruits, vegetables).

Description: A neurological disorder affecting coordination, balance, and speech, often resulting from damage to the cerebellum.
Symptoms: Poor coordination, difficulty walking, slurred speech, tremors, difficulty swallowing.
Precautions: Physical therapy, speech therapy, regular neurological monitoring, avoid alcohol.
Medications: Symptomatic treatment, physical therapy, occupational therapy, genetic counseling for hereditary ataxia.
Diets: Balanced diet, ensure proper hydration, include omega-3 fatty acids, maintain a diet high in antioxidants (e.g., fruits, vegetables, nuts).

Description: A type of arrhythmia where the upper chambers of the heart beat rapidly, causing a fast and irregular heart rate.
Symptoms: Palpitations, shortness of breath, dizziness, fatigue, chest pain, fainting.
Precautions: Avoid alcohol and caffeine, maintain a healthy weight, manage stress.
Medications: Blood thinners, antiarrhythmics, beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, catheter ablation.
Diets: Heart-healthy diet, rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and omega-3s, limit salt and processed foods, avoid excessive alcohol.

Description: A developmental disorder that affects communication, behavior, and social interaction, with a wide range of severity.
Symptoms: Difficulty with social interaction, repetitive behaviors, communication challenges, sensory sensitivities.
Precautions: Early intervention, regular developmental screening, therapy to enhance communication and social skills.
Medications: Behavioral therapy, speech therapy, occupational therapy, medications (e.g., for anxiety, hyperactivity, or depression).
Diets: Balanced diet, ensure adequate vitamins and minerals, consider gluten and casein-free diets (for some cases), small frequent meals to support energy levels.

Description: A life-threatening infection of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, typically caused by bacteria.
Symptoms: High fever, severe headache, stiff neck, sensitivity to light, confusion, vomiting, seizures.
Precautions: Vaccinations, avoid contact with infected individuals, maintain proper hygiene, regular health check-ups.
Medications: Intravenous antibiotics, corticosteroids, fluids, pain relievers.
Diets: Adequate hydration, small frequent meals, include immune-boosting foods (e.g., fruits, vegetables, lean proteins).

Description: A fluid-filled cyst behind the knee caused by swelling and inflammation, often due to arthritis or injury.
Symptoms: Swelling behind the knee, pain, stiffness, limited range of motion, visible bulge.
Precautions: Avoid excessive knee strain, maintain healthy weight, physical therapy.
Medications: NSAIDs, corticosteroid injections, aspiration of the cyst, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, rich in omega-3s, avoid processed foods, ensure adequate hydration, maintain a healthy weight.

Description: A fluid-filled cyst in the Bartholin glands, located on either side of the vaginal opening, often caused by a blockage in the duct.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, discomfort during sitting or walking, painful intercourse, fever (if infected).
Precautions: Maintain proper genital hygiene, avoid tight-fitting clothing, use sitz baths.
Medications: Antibiotics (if infected), sitz baths, drainage, surgical removal in recurrent cases.
Diets: Balanced diet, adequate hydration, include foods rich in vitamin C to support immune health, avoid excessive sugar intake to reduce infection risk.

Description: A functional disorder where bile does not flow properly from the gallbladder, causing digestive issues.
Symptoms: Upper abdominal pain, nausea, bloating, indigestion, intolerance to fatty foods.
Precautions: Avoid fatty and fried foods, regular monitoring, maintain a healthy weight.
Medications: Cholecystectomy (surgical removal of gallbladder), pain relief medications.
Diets: Low-fat diet, small frequent meals, avoid spicy and greasy foods, increase intake of fiber-rich foods (e.g., fruits, vegetables).

Description: Bony growths that develop on the edges of bones, often as a result of arthritis or wear and tear.
Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, limited range of motion, swelling, numbness or tingling if pressing on nerves.
Precautions: Maintain healthy weight, proper posture, regular exercise, avoid joint overuse.
Medications: NSAIDs, corticosteroid injections, physical therapy, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, rich in omega-3s, avoid processed foods, ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D intake for bone health.

Description: A rare but serious illness caused by a toxin produced by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum, leading to muscle paralysis.
Symptoms: Muscle weakness, difficulty breathing, trouble swallowing, blurred vision, dry mouth, slurred speech.
Precautions: Avoid consuming improperly preserved or canned foods, practice good hygiene with wounds, seek immediate care for suspicious symptoms.
Medications: Antitoxins, mechanical ventilation for breathing difficulties, supportive care.
Diets: Small, frequent meals, avoid alcohol, adequate hydration, include easily digestible and soft foods as muscle weakness improves.

Description: A condition that causes brief episodes of dizziness when moving the head in certain positions due to displaced crystals in the inner ear.
Symptoms: Dizziness, lightheadedness, loss of balance, nausea, vomiting.
Precautions: Avoid sudden head movements, sleep with elevated head, use caution when changing positions.
Medications: Epley maneuver (physical therapy), anti-nausea medications (if needed).
Diets: Balanced diet, avoid excessive salt and caffeine (may worsen dizziness), stay hydrated, small frequent meals to avoid nausea.

Description: Damage to the brachial plexus, a network of nerves that send signals from the spinal cord to the shoulder, arm, and hand, often due to trauma or pressure.
Symptoms: Weakness in the arm or hand, numbness, tingling, burning sensation, limited range of motion.
Precautions: Avoid strenuous activities, proper posture, physical therapy.
Medications: Pain relievers, physical therapy, surgery for severe cases.
Diets: Balanced diet, adequate hydration, include foods rich in vitamins B6 and B12 for nerve health, avoid alcohol and smoking.

Description: A slower-than-normal heart rate, which can cause insufficient blood flow to the organs.
Symptoms: Fatigue, dizziness, shortness of breath, fainting, chest pain, confusion.
Precautions: Avoid excessive alcohol, caffeine, and smoking, regular heart monitoring, manage stress.
Medications: Pacemaker (in severe cases), beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, antiarrhythmic medications.
Diets: Heart-healthy diet, low in sodium, rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, and omega-3 fatty acids, avoid excessive salt and processed foods.

Description: A chronic lung disease most commonly seen in premature infants who require oxygen therapy, leading to difficulty breathing and lung development issues.
Symptoms: Rapid breathing, wheezing, coughing, difficulty feeding, frequent respiratory infections.
Precautions: Minimize exposure to respiratory infections, regular follow-ups, avoid smoking.
Medications: Oxygen therapy, bronchodilators, corticosteroids, diuretics (to reduce fluid buildup).
Diets: High-calorie diet (for growth and energy needs), small frequent meals, adequate hydration, nutrient-dense foods to support lung health.

Description: A condition in which a person unconsciously grinds or clenches their teeth, often during sleep, leading to dental and jaw problems.
Symptoms: Jaw pain, headaches, worn-down teeth, ear pain, disrupted sleep, tooth sensitivity.
Precautions: Stress management, use of a mouth guard, avoid caffeine and alcohol before bed.
Medications: Mouth guards, muscle relaxants (if needed), behavioral therapy, dental treatments for severe cases.
Diets: Avoid caffeine and alcohol, especially in the evening, hydrate well, include magnesium-rich foods (e.g., spinach, almonds) to help relax muscles.

Description: A bony bump that forms on the joint at the base of the big toe, causing pain and misalignment of the toe.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, redness, difficulty walking, restricted movement of the big toe.
Precautions: Wear comfortable, well-fitting shoes, avoid high heels, use padding or splints.
Medications: NSAIDs, corticosteroid injections, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, avoid processed and sugary foods, maintain a healthy weight, include omega-3 fatty acids to reduce inflammation.

Description: A condition caused by compression of the median nerve in the wrist, leading to pain, numbness, and weakness in the hand and fingers.
Symptoms: Numbness or tingling in the hand, wrist pain, weakness in grip strength, swelling.
Precautions: Avoid repetitive wrist movements, ergonomic workplace setup, take frequent breaks.
Medications: NSAIDs, wrist splints, corticosteroid injections, surgery for severe cases.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory diet, rich in omega-3s, avoid processed foods, hydrate well, include vitamin B6 for nerve health (e.g., poultry, bananas, potatoes).

Description: Inflammation of the cervix, often caused by infection, leading to pain, abnormal discharge, and bleeding.
Symptoms: Vaginal discharge, pain during intercourse, pelvic pain, bleeding between periods, urinary issues.
Precautions: Regular STD screenings, avoid douching, practice safe sex.
Medications: Antibiotics, antiviral or antifungal medications (depending on the cause), pain relief.
Diets: Balanced diet, adequate hydration, immune-boosting foods (e.g., fruits, vegetables, lean proteins), avoid high-sugar and processed foods.

Description: A skin condition that occurs after exposure to cold, damp conditions, leading to red, itchy, and swollen skin.
Symptoms: Red or purple skin patches, swelling, itching, burning sensation, blisters in severe cases.
Precautions: Keep warm, avoid sudden temperature changes, moisturize skin, wear warm clothing.
Medications: Topical corticosteroids, pain relievers, vasodilators (in severe cases).
Diets: Stay hydrated, balanced diet with adequate vitamins (especially vitamin D and K for skin health), include warming foods (e.g., soups, teas).

Description: Hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in the gallbladder, often leading to pain and digestive issues.
Symptoms: Upper right abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, indigestion, bloating, back pain.
Precautions: Avoid fatty foods, maintain a healthy weight, regular physical activity.
Medications: Pain relief medications, surgery (cholecystectomy), bile acid pills (to dissolve small stones).
Diets: Low-fat diet, avoid fried and greasy foods, increase intake of fiber-rich foods (e.g., fruits, vegetables), small frequent meals to prevent gallbladder irritation.

Description: A bacterial infection that causes inflammation of the colon, often after antibiotic use, leading to diarrhea and abdominal pain.
Symptoms: Watery diarrhea, abdominal cramping, fever, nausea, loss of appetite, dehydration.
Precautions: Avoid unnecessary use of antibiotics, practice good hygiene, regular handwashing.
Medications: Antibiotics (metronidazole, vancomycin), probiotics, fluids, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: High-fiber diet, include probiotic-rich foods (e.g., yogurt, kefir), avoid spicy and fatty foods, ensure adequate hydration, small frequent meals.

Description: Inflammation of the inner lining of the colon, which can be due to infections, ischemia, or chronic conditions like ulcerative colitis.
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, diarrhea (with or without blood), cramping, weight loss, fatigue.
Precautions: Avoid trigger foods, maintain proper hydration, regular check-ups.
Medications: Anti-inflammatory medications, antibiotics, immunosuppressants, corticosteroids.
Diets: Low-fiber diet during flare-ups, avoid spicy and acidic foods, small frequent meals, increase intake of omega-3 fatty acids, adequate hydration.

Description: A chronic condition in which the heart is unable to pump blood effectively, leading to fluid buildup in the lungs and other parts of the body.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, swollen legs, rapid heartbeat, persistent cough, weight gain.
Precautions: Regular blood pressure and cholesterol monitoring, avoid excessive salt, quit smoking.
Medications: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, blood thinners, surgery (in severe cases).
Diets: Low-sodium diet, avoid processed foods, include potassium-rich foods (e.g., bananas, leafy greens), limit alcohol, ensure adequate hydration.

Description: A condition where the right side of the heart fails due to high blood pressure in the lungs, often caused by chronic lung disease.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, chest pain, swelling in legs, rapid heart rate, fainting.
Precautions: Manage underlying lung disease, avoid smoking, regular monitoring of heart and lung function.
Medications: Diuretics, oxygen therapy, vasodilators, anticoagulants.
Diets: Low-sodium diet, rich in omega-3s and fiber, avoid processed and fatty foods, small frequent meals, stay hydrated.

Description: A condition where long-term corticosteroid use leads to weakened bones, increasing the risk of fractures.
Symptoms: Bone pain, fractures, loss of height, kyphosis (curved spine).
Precautions: Regular bone density screenings, adequate calcium and vitamin D intake, regular weight-bearing exercise.
Medications: Calcium and vitamin D supplements, bisphosphonates, selective estrogen receptor modulators (SERMs).
Diets: High-calcium foods (e.g., dairy, leafy greens), vitamin D-rich foods (e.g., fish, fortified cereals), avoid excessive alcohol and caffeine, maintain a balanced diet.

Description: A viral infection that often affects children and can cause hand, foot, and mouth disease, herpangina, and other conditions.
Symptoms: Fever, sore throat, mouth sores, rash on hands and feet, irritability, loss of appetite.
Precautions: Practice good hygiene, avoid close contact with infected individuals, proper handwashing.
Medications: Supportive care (fluids, pain relief), topical anesthetics for mouth sores, antivirals (in severe cases).
Diets: Hydration is key, include easy-to-eat soft foods (e.g., soups, smoothies), avoid spicy or acidic foods, include immune-boosting foods (e.g., fruits, vegetables).

Description: A viral infection that causes swelling of the airways, leading to a distinctive barking cough, hoarseness, and difficulty breathing, most common in children.
Symptoms: Barking cough, hoarseness, difficulty breathing, fever, stridor (high-pitched breathing sound).
Precautions: Humidified air, hydration, avoid exposure to smoke, proper handwashing.
Medications: Steroids (to reduce inflammation), nebulized epinephrine (in severe cases), pain relief medications.
Diets: Ensure hydration, small frequent meals, include nutrient-dense foods to support the immune system (e.g., fruits, vegetables, lean proteins).

Description: A condition in which one or both testicles fail to descend into the scrotum, typically occurring in newborn boys.
Symptoms: Absence of one or both testicles in the scrotum, asymmetrical appearance of the scrotum.
Precautions: Regular check-ups, ensure proper testicular health monitoring, early intervention.
Medications: Hormonal therapy, surgery (orchiopexy) to correct the position of the testicle(s).
Diets: Balanced diet, adequate hydration, include foods rich in vitamins and minerals to support overall health, maintain a healthy weight.

Description: A condition where the bladder drops into the vagina due to weakening of the pelvic floor muscles, leading to urinary and pelvic issues.
Symptoms: Urinary leakage, difficulty emptying the bladder, pressure in the pelvis, discomfort during intercourse.
Precautions: Perform pelvic floor exercises (Kegels), maintain healthy weight, avoid heavy lifting.
Medications: Pelvic floor therapy, pessary (vaginal support device), surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Balanced diet, include fiber-rich foods to prevent constipation, maintain a healthy weight, ensure adequate hydration, avoid excessive caffeine.

Description: Inflammation of the tendons on the thumb side of the wrist, often caused by repetitive hand movements.
Symptoms: Pain and swelling near the base of the thumb, difficulty gripping, pain when turning the wrist or making a fist.
Precautions: Avoid repetitive thumb movements, proper wrist ergonomics, rest the wrist, wear supportive braces.
Medications: NSAIDs, corticosteroid injections, physical therapy, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Balanced diet rich in anti-inflammatory foods, include omega-3s (e.g., fish, nuts), avoid processed foods, stay hydrated.

Description: A general term for inflammation of the skin, often caused by allergies, irritants, or immune system issues.
Symptoms: Red, itchy, swollen skin, blisters, dry patches, scaling or cracking skin.
Precautions: Avoid triggers like harsh soaps, allergens, or chemicals, use moisturizers, wear protective clothing.
Medications: Topical corticosteroids, antihistamines, moisturizers, antibiotics (for infection).
Diets: Hydrating foods, include omega-3 fatty acids for skin health, avoid processed foods and excessive sugar, drink plenty of water to keep skin hydrated.

Description: A serious complication of diabetes where the body produces excess blood acids (ketones) due to insufficient insulin.
Symptoms: Excessive thirst, frequent urination, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, fruity-smelling breath, confusion, rapid breathing.
Precautions: Regular blood sugar monitoring, take insulin as prescribed, stay hydrated.
Medications: Insulin therapy, IV fluids, electrolytes, emergency care for severe cases.
Diets: Low-carb, balanced diet, include high-fiber vegetables, avoid sugary foods and drinks, stay hydrated with water or sugar-free beverages.

Description: A condition where the upper arm bone pops out of the shoulder socket, usually due to trauma or injury.
Symptoms: Severe shoulder pain, swelling, visible deformity, inability to move the arm, bruising.
Precautions: Avoid risky sports or activities, practice proper form when lifting or exercising, wear protective gear.
Medications: Pain relievers, muscle relaxants, closed reduction (to reposition the shoulder), physical therapy.
Diets: Anti-inflammatory foods, stay hydrated, include foods rich in calcium and vitamin D to promote healing, avoid processed and sugary foods.

Description: A hand deformity that develops over time, causing the fingers to bend inward toward the palm due to thickened tissue.
Symptoms: Gradual thickening of the tissue in the palm, lumps or nodules under the skin, bent fingers that can't fully extend.
Precautions: Stretching exercises, avoid repetitive hand movements, use protective gloves when handling tools.
Medications: Collagenase injections, needle aponeurotomy, surgery in severe cases.
Diets: Balanced diet rich in anti-inflammatory foods, include protein for tissue health, avoid excessive alcohol and sugar, stay hydrated.

Description: A condition characterized by discomfort or pain in the upper abdomen, often related to eating or digestive disorders.
Symptoms: Upper abdominal pain, bloating, nausea, early fullness, burning sensation, belching.
Precautions: Eat slowly, avoid overeating, limit trigger foods (e.g., spicy, fatty, or acidic foods), avoid lying down after eating.
Medications: Antacids, H2 blockers, proton pump inhibitors, prokinetics.
Diets: Eat smaller, more frequent meals, avoid trigger foods like fatty or spicy dishes, include ginger or peppermint to soothe the stomach, avoid alcohol and caffeine.

Description: A condition where breathing becomes difficult, often a symptom of underlying heart, lung, or other systemic issues.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, chest tightness, wheezing, rapid or shallow breathing, feeling of suffocation.
Precautions: Avoid strenuous activities, stay hydrated, manage chronic conditions like asthma or heart disease, use a fan or air purifier.
Medications: Bronchodilators, oxygen therapy, diuretics (for heart-related dyspnea), corticosteroids, or antibiotics (if related to infection).
Diets: Stay hydrated, eat small, frequent meals, avoid excessive salt, avoid foods that produce gas (e.g., beans, cabbage), include foods rich in omega-3s for lung health.
